newsitem.title: USA: CBOT wheat closes higher on fund-buying correction.
newsitem.headline: CBOT wheat closes higher on fund-buying correction.

text.p: Fund buying amid signals the market was technically oversold boosted CBOT soft red winter wheat futures to a higher close, traders said.
"It was just grossly oversold and had to correct," a trader said. "You can go down only so long."
Wheat recently has been ratcheting to a series of contract lows and three-year lows amid reports of excellent yields in the U.S. winter wheat harvesting region.
Funds Tuesday bought at least eight million bushels of wheat and Cargill Inc sold five million bushels of September and sold two million December, traders said.
Cargill's action probably was hedge selling, the traders said.

The nine day relative strength index (RSI) for the July contract fell to 16.6 percent at Monday's close, a signal the market was extremely oversold. An RSI of 30 or less is considered an oversold market.
Support to wheat futures Tuesday also may have come from forecasts for showers this week in the U.S. winter wheat region which could slow wheat harvesting.
Wheat closed unchanged to 3-3/4 cents per bushel higher, with July up three at $3.16-1/2.
